item.title: Distinct unfolded protein responses mitigate or mediate effects of nonlethal deprivation of *C. elegans* sleep in different tissues
Sleep bouts are not essential for *C. elegans* survival, but FoxO is important for compensatory sleep
Example Talk
item.description: Embed your slides or video here using shortcodes. Further details can easily be added using Markdown and $\rm \LaTeX$ math code.

item.title: Homeostasis in *C. elegans* sleep is characterized by two behaviorally and genetically distinct mechanisms
Male Mating Behaviour: The importance of waiting
item.description:
This was an Insight article I wrote to accompany an eLife paper from René García’s lab that identified the neural circuit in C. elegans males responsible for regulating the post-mating refractory period that follows ejaculation.

Here is a link to the paper: Caenorhabditis elegans male sensory-motor neurons and dopaminergic support cells couple ejaculation and post-ejaculatory behaviors

  • A * denotes first author contribution

item.title: The *Caenorhabditis elegans* interneuron ALA is (also) a high-threshold mechanosensor
